Aggavamsa：Thera of Pagan. He wrote a Pāli grammar，the Saddaniti，in 1154 （Gv.63； SvD.v.1238； Sās.74）. He was tutor to King Narapatisithu of Pagan （Bode，16）.



The Gandha-Vamsa calls him a native of Jambudīpa （p.67），but his name occurs among the famous residents in the retired monastery of the northern plateau above Pagan，the cradle of Pāli-Burmese literature. Forchhammer Report，p.2； Jardine Prize Essay，p.34.
